$$\mathrm{kJ} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}$$ (Nearest integer)

Given : $$\Delta_{\mathrm{dis}} \mathrm{H}_{\mathrm{Cl}_{2(\mathrm{~g})}^{\theta}}^{\ominus}=240 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}, \Delta_{\mathrm{eg}} \mathrm{H}_{\mathrm{Cl_{(g)}}}^{\ominus}=-350 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$,

$${\mathrm{\Delta _{hyd}}H_{Cl_{(g)}^ - }^\Theta  =  - 380}$$ $$\mathrm{kJ~mol^{-1}}$$

questions.question_text:
For the system of linear equations

$$x+y+z=6$$

$$\alpha x+\beta y+7 z=3$$

$$x+2 y+3 z=14$$

which of the following is NOT true ?
questions.subject: Mathematics

options.A: If $$\alpha=\beta=7$$, then the system has no solution
options.B: For every point $$(\alpha, \beta) \neq(7,7)$$ on the line $$x-2 y+7=0$$, the system has infinitely many solutions
options.C: There is a unique point $$(\alpha, \beta)$$ on the line $$x+2 y+18=0$$ for which the system has infinitely many solutions
options.D: If $$\alpha=\beta$$ and $$\alpha \neq 7$$, then the system has a unique solution

options.A: Metal ball will reach the earth's surface earlier than the insulating ball
options.B: Both will reach the earth's surface simultaneously.
options.C: Insulating ball will reach the earth's surface earlier than the metal ball
options.D: Time taken by them to reach the earth's surface will be independent of the properties of their materials

questions.question_text: A lift of mass $$\mathrm{M}=500 \mathrm{~kg}$$ is descending with speed of $$2 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}$$. Its supporting cable begins to slip thus allowing it to fall with a constant acceleration of $$2 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}$$. The kinetic energy of the lift at the end of fall through to a distance of $$6 \mathrm{~m}$$ will be _____________ $$\mathrm{kJ}$$.

questions.question_text:
The speed of a swimmer is $$4 \mathrm{~km} \mathrm{~h}^{-1}$$ in still water. If the swimmer makes his strokes normal to the flow of river of width $$1 \mathrm{~km}$$, he reaches a point $$750 \mathrm{~m}$$ down the stream on the opposite bank.

The speed of the river water is ___________ $$\mathrm{km} ~\mathrm{h}^{-1}$$
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:

The speed of the river water is ___________ $$\mathrm{km} ~\mathrm{h}^{-1}$$

questions.question_text: A solid sphere of mass $$1 \mathrm{~kg}$$ rolls without slipping on a plane surface. Its kinetic energy is $$7 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~J}$$. The speed of the centre of mass of the sphere is __________ $$\operatorname{cm~s}^{-1}$$
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text:
Expression for an electric field is given by $$\overrightarrow{\mathrm{E}}=4000 x^{2} \hat{i} \frac{\mathrm{V}}{\mathrm{m}}$$. The electric flux through the cube of side $$20 \mathrm{~cm}$$ when placed in electric field (as shown in the figure) 
is __________ $$\mathrm{V} \mathrm{~cm}$$.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text:
A thin rod having a length of $$1 \mathrm{~m}$$ and area of cross-section $$3 \times 10^{-6} \mathrm{~m}^{2}$$ is suspended vertically from one end. The rod is cooled from $$210^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$$ to $$160^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$$. After cooling, a mass $$\mathrm{M}$$ is attached at the lower end of the rod such that the length of rod again becomes $$1 \mathrm{~m}$$. Young's modulus and coefficient of linear expansion of the rod are $$2 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{~N} \mathrm{~m}^{-2}$$ and $$2 \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{~K}^{-1}$$, respectively. The value of $$\mathrm{M}$$ is __________ $$\mathrm{kg}$$.

(Take $$\mathrm{g=10~m~s^{-2}}$$)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A thin rod having a length of $$1 \mathrm{~m}$$ and area of cross-section $$3 \times 10^{-6} \mathrm{~m}^{2}$$ is suspended vertically from one end. The rod is cooled from $$210^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$$ to $$160^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$$. After cooling, a mass $$\mathrm{M}$$ is attached at the lower end of the rod such that the length of rod again becomes $$1 \mathrm{~m}$$. Young's modulus and coefficient of linear expansion of the rod are $$2 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{~N} \mathrm{~m}^{-2}$$ and $$2 \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{~K}^{-1}$$, respectively. The value of $$\mathrm{M}$$ is __________ $$\mathrm{kg}$$. 
(Take $$\mathrm{g=10~m~s^{-2}}$$)

questions.question_text:
In a medium the speed of light wave decreases to $$0.2$$ times to its speed in free space The ratio of relative permittivity to the refractive index of the medium is $$x: 1$$. The value of $$x$$ is _________.

(Given speed of light in free space $$=3 \times 10^{8} \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}$$ and for the given medium $$\mu_{\mathrm{r}}=1$$)
questions.subject: Physics

If the current is in phase with the emf, the amplitude of current of the circuit is $$\sqrt{x}$$ A. The value of $$x$$ is ___________
